document_data.name: ''Thoughts On Life and Wizardry''
document_data.author: [[Laeral Silverhand]]
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Thoughts On Life and Wizardry''''' was a book written by [[Laeral Silverhand]], writing as "Laeral of the Nine". It was written in the {{YearlinkName|1335}}, while she was a member of the [[adventuring company]] known as [[the Nine]]. It was a collection of her observations on the world and on [[magic]].{{Cite polyhedron/74/The Everwinking Eye: Words To The Wise|14}}{{Cite web/The Candlekeep Collection}}
{{quote|How else can we touch each other, down the passing years, save by words?|''Thoughts On Life and Wizardry''}}
document_data.Availability:
Around [[1372 DR]], a copy was in the holdings at [[Candlekeep]].
{{quote|I watched a [[wolf]]cub challenge his pack leader this morning. The guile and experience of the old wolf won out again, despite the younger's strength and speed. Would that youth did not always rely on bluster and newfound strength...|''Thoughts On Life and Wizardry''}}
